alert.note: Alert for Baylor; Foard; Knox; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Foard, Knox, southwestern Wilbarger and Baylor Counties through 815 PM CDT... At 738 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southeast of Thalia to 4 miles north of Red Springs to near Knox City. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seymour, Munday, Knox City, Benjamin, Goree, Red Springs, Thalia, Gilliland, Bomarton, Lake Kemp, Mabelle, Vera, and Rhineland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
